definitions.definition: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind

examples.text: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
The dam project was originally conceived in 1997.
They conceived a theory and stuck to it.
The course is very broadly conceived.

definitions.sensetop: conceive of somebody/something (as something)conceive (that)…conceive what/how, etc…

examples.text: God is often conceived of as male.
I cannot conceive *(= I do not believe)* (that) he would wish to harm us.
I cannot conceive what it must be like.
It is difficult to conceive of a society without money.
I cannot conceive why you paid out so much money.
We conceive of ourselves as individuals.

definitions.definition: when a woman conceives or conceives a child, she becomes pregnant

examples.text: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
She was unable to conceive a child naturally and was offered fertility treatment.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French concevoir, from Latin concipere, from com- ‘together’ + capere ‘take’.
